content: <ce:section-title id="sect0035">Preparation of the cuprous complexes 1–4</ce:section-title><ce:section-title id="sect0040">Synthesis of [Cu(2-PBO)(μ<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>-I)]<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> (1)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0030" view="all">To a stirred solution of ligand 2-PBO (0.0196 g, 0.10 mmol) in hot MeOH (10 mL) was added CuI (0.0190 g, 0.10 mmol) in CH<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>CN (5 mL). The block crystals suitable for X-ray diffraction studies were obtained by evaporation the mixed solution after two weeks at room temperature. 89% yield. Anal. Calcd for C<ce:inf loc="post">24</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">16</ce:inf>Cu<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>I<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>:C, 37.28; H, 2.09; N, 7.25%. Found:C, 38.29; H, 2.27; N, 8.52%. IR (KBr pellet, ν/cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3055 (w), 1541 (w), 1469 (m), 1429 (m), 1356 (s), 1257 (w), 1126 (m), 810 (m), 744 (s), 696 (w). <ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>H NMR (400 MHz, d<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>-DMSO):<ce:italic>δ</ce:italic> (ppm) = 7.46–7.88(m, 4H, H-Ar), 8.03–8.42(m, 3H, H-Py), 8.88–8.92(m, 1H, H-Py).</ce:para><ce:section-title id="sect0045">Synthesis of [Cu<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>(4-PBO)<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>(μ<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>-I)<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>]<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf> (2)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0035" view="all">A mixture of 4-PBO (0.1 mmol), CuI (0.2 mmol), acetonitrile (8.0 mL) wassealed in a stainless steel reactor with a 15 mL Teflon liner and heated at 140 °C for 3 days, and then slowly cooled to room temperature. A large amount of dark red and block-shaped crystals of were found. Yield: 92%. Calcd for C<ce:inf loc="post">12</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">8</ce:inf>CuIN<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O: C, 37.28; H, 2.09; N, 7.25%. Found: C, 37.19; H, 2.02; N, 7.18%. IR (KBr pellet, ν/cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3047 (w), 2926 (w), 1539 (w), 1473 (m), 1419 (s), 1346 (m), 1271 (m), 1111 (w), 1058 (w), 842 (m), 810 (m), 740 (s), 698 (m), 511 (w). <ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>H NMR (400 MHz, d<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>-DMSO): <ce:italic>δ</ce:italic> (ppm) = 7.51–7.92(m, 4H, H-Ar), 8.12–8.34(m, 2H, H-Py), 8.77–8.96(m, 2H, H-C-N, H-Py).</ce:para><ce:section-title id="sect0050">Synthesis of {[Cu(4-PBO)(μ<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>-SCN)]<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>}<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf> (3)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0040" view="all">A solution of 2-PBO (0.0588 g, 0.3 mmol) in 4 mL of dichloromethane was very carefully placed on the bottom of the tube. 1 mL of acetonitrile as the buffer was slowly layered onto the ligand solution. A clear solution of CuSCN (0.0243 g, 0.2 mmol) and NH<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>SCN (0.0304 g, 0.4 mmol) in 4 mL of acetonitrile was then very carefully layered on the top of the buffer solution. After 1 week, red block crystals of 1 were collected by filtration and dried in vacuo. Yield: 78%. Elemental analysis for C<ce:inf loc="post">13</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">8</ce:inf>CuN<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>OS: C, 49.13; H, 2.54; N, 5.03%. Found: C, 49.06; H, 2.46; N, 4.95%. IR (KBr pellet, ν/cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3109 (w), 2364 (w), 2048 (m), 1620 (s), 1546 (m), 1421 (m), 1350 (w), 1220 (w), 1060 (w), 814 (m), 752 (s), 692 (w). <ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>H NMR (400 MHz, d<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>-DMSO): <ce:italic>δ</ce:italic> (ppm) = 7.48–7.88(m, 4H, H-Ar), 8.03–8.22(m, 2H, H-Py), 8.89–8.97(m, 2H, H-Py).</ce:para><ce:section-title id="sect0055">Synthesis of {[Cu(BBO)(μ<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>-Br)]<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>}<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf> (4)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0045" view="all">The synthesis of complex <ce:bold>4</ce:bold> is similar to <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> except for using BBO (0.1 mmol) and CuBr (0.2 mmol). Calcd for C<ce:inf loc="post">18</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">16</ce:inf>BrCuN<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>: C, 49.61; H, 3.70; N, 6.43%. Found: C, 49.52; H, 3.66; N, 6.39%. IR (KBr pellet, ν/cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3053 (w), 2943 (w), 1604 (w), 1560 (s), 1454 (m), 1244 (m), 1166 (w), 779 (w), 744 (s). <ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>H NMR (400 MHz, d<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>-DMSO):<ce:italic>δ</ce:italic> (ppm) = 2.11–2.19(m, 4H, H-CH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>), 3.12–3.33(m, 4H, H-CH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>), 7.45–7.92(m, 8H, -H-Ar).</ce:para>
clean_text:
Preparation of the cuprous complexes 1-4

Synthesis of [Cu(2-PBO)(μ2-I)]2 (1)

To a stirred solution of ligand 2-PBO (0.0196g, 0.10mmol) in hot MeOH (10mL) was added CuI (0.0190g, 0.10mmol) in CH3CN (5mL). The block crystals suitable for X-ray diffraction studies were obtained by evaporation the mixed solution after two weeks at room temperature. 89% yield. Anal. Calcd for C24H16Cu2I2N4O2:C, 37.28; H, 2.09; N, 7.25%. Found:C, 38.29; H, 2.27; N, 8.52%. IR (KBr pellet, ν/cm-1): 3055 (w), 1541 (w), 1469 (m), 1429 (m), 1356 (s), 1257 (w), 1126 (m), 810 (m), 744 (s), 696 (w). 1H NMR (400MHz, d6-DMSO):δ (ppm)=7.46-7.88(m, 4H, H-Ar), 8.03-8.42(m, 3H, H-Py), 8.88-8.92(m, 1H, H-Py).

Synthesis of [Cu4(4-PBO)4(μ3-I)4]n (2)

A mixture of 4-PBO (0.1mmol), CuI (0.2mmol), acetonitrile (8.0mL) wassealed in a stainless steel reactor with a 15mL Teflon liner and heated at 140°C for 3 days, and then slowly cooled to room temperature. A large amount of dark red and block-shaped crystals of were found. Yield: 92%. Calcd for C12H8CuIN2O: C, 37.28; H, 2.09; N, 7.25%. Found: C, 37.19; H, 2.02; N, 7.18%. IR (KBr pellet, ν/cm-1): 3047 (w), 2926 (w), 1539 (w), 1473 (m), 1419 (s), 1346 (m), 1271 (m), 1111 (w), 1058 (w), 842 (m), 810 (m), 740 (s), 698 (m), 511 (w). 1H NMR (400MHz, d6-DMSO): δ (ppm)=7.51-7.92(m, 4H, H-Ar), 8.12-8.34(m, 2H, H-Py), 8.77-8.96(m, 2H, H-C-N, H-Py).

Synthesis of {[Cu(4-PBO)(μ3-SCN)]2}n (3)

A solution of 2-PBO (0.0588g, 0.3mmol) in 4mL of dichloromethane was very carefully placed on the bottom of the tube. 1mL of acetonitrile as the buffer was slowly layered onto the ligand solution. A clear solution of CuSCN (0.0243g, 0.2mmol) and NH4SCN (0.0304g, 0.4mmol) in 4mL of acetonitrile was then very carefully layered on the top of the buffer solution. After 1 week, red block crystals of 1 were collected by filtration and dried in vacuo. Yield: 78%. Elemental analysis for C13H8CuN3OS: C, 49.13; H, 2.54; N, 5.03%. Found: C, 49.06; H, 2.46; N, 4.95%. IR (KBr pellet, ν/cm-1): 3109 (w), 2364 (w), 2048 (m), 1620 (s), 1546 (m), 1421 (m), 1350 (w), 1220 (w), 1060 (w), 814 (m), 752 (s), 692 (w). 1H NMR (400MHz, d6-DMSO): δ (ppm)=7.48-7.88(m, 4H, H-Ar), 8.03-8.22(m, 2H, H-Py), 8.89-8.97(m, 2H, H-Py).

Synthesis of {[Cu(BBO)(μ2-Br)]2}n (4)

The synthesis of complex 4 is similar to 2 except for using BBO (0.1mmol) and CuBr (0.2mmol). Calcd for C18H16BrCuN2O2: C, 49.61; H, 3.70; N, 6.43%. Found: C, 49.52; H, 3.66; N, 6.39%. IR (KBr pellet, ν/cm-1): 3053 (w), 2943 (w), 1604 (w), 1560 (s), 1454 (m), 1244 (m), 1166 (w), 779 (w), 744 (s). 1H NMR (400MHz, d6-DMSO):δ (ppm)=2.11-2.19(m, 4H, H-CH2), 3.12-3.33(m, 4H, H-CH2), 7.45-7.92(m, 8H, -H-Ar).
